content:
You've got a nice selection there!

Out of those, I think the Cabernet Sauvignon or Merlot would pair nicely with your chili mac. Both of these full-bodied reds have the structure and tannins to stand up to the rich, savory flavors of the dish.

The Cabernet Sauvignon, with its bold flavors of dark fruit, spice, and subtle tannins, might complement the bold, meaty flavors of the chili. Its tannins can help balance the fattiness of the pasta and cheese.

The Merlot, with its plum and blackberry flavors and smooth, approachable texture, might add a fruity and velvety dimension to the dish. Its moderate tannins can help balance the spiciness of the chili.

The Pinot Grigio, being a crisp and refreshing white wine, might not be the best match for chili mac. It's a great wine for lighter, more delicate dishes, but it might get lost amidst the bold flavors of the chili and pasta.

Feel free to experiment and see which one you enjoy the most! If you're in the mood for a bold, full-bodied red, go for the Cabernet Sauvignon. If you prefer a smoother, more approachable red, the Merlot might be the way to go.

Let me know how it turns out, and happy sipping!
